alert.note: Alert for Lexington (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 4:38PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Lexington and central Richland Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 438 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Columbia Metro Airport, or over Oak Grove, moving southwest at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Columbia, Lexington, West Columbia, Cayce, St. Andrews, Red Bank, Oak Grove, South Congaree, Pine Ridge, Riverbanks Zoo, SC State Farmer`s Market, Columbia Metro Airport, SC State Fair Grounds, West Columbia Riverwalk, Five Points, Cayce Riverwalk, Guignard Park, Dixiana, Seven Oaks and Olympia. This includes the following highways... Interstate 126 between mile markers 0 and 3. Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 51 and 67. Interstate 26 between mile markers 105 and 120. Interstate 77 between mile markers 0 and 6. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
